attributes.copyright: ¬© 2025 Savannah Gilbo, Inc. | Fiction Writing Made Easy

description.standard:
Master the art of the jaw-dropping plot twist and transform your readers from passive page-turners into gasping, can't-put-it-down fans.
Ever gasped out loud while reading a thriller? That moment when everything flips upside down and you think, "I should have seen it coming!" üò±
That's the power of a well-crafted plot twist.
Creating these goosebump-inducing moments isn't magic‚Äîit's a skill that any writer can master, even if you‚Äôre just starting out. And who better to learn from than someone whose superpower is brainstorming plot twists?
Samantha Skal is the director of Thriller Fest, the co-founder of Shadows and Secrets Writing Retreats (held in Salem‚Äôs most haunted hotel!), and a certified Author Accelerator book coach specializing in mystery, thriller, and suspense. So to say she knows a thing or two about crafting plot twists would be an understatement.
In the episode, you‚Äôll hear us talk about things like:
[04:45] The difference between using red herrings in mysteries and thrillers(and why mixing them up might be killing your story's suspense)[07:11] Why "playing fair" with readers is the cardinal rule of plot twist writing‚Äîand how breaking it turns clever twists into manipulative disappointments[15:12] Why starting with your villain (not your protagonist) is the secret to crafting plot twists that are surprising yet inevitable[24:00] How your character's personal baggage can become your most powerful tool for misdirecting readers (without feeling manipulative)[40:45] The counterintuitive reason why vague storytelling kills suspense‚Äîand what to do instead to create maximum tensionWhether you're excited to start your first novel or stuck somewhere in the middle of a manuscript, wondering how to surprise your readers, this episode will help you craft plot twists that feel both surprising and inevitable.¬†
‚≠ê Rate + Review + Follow on Apple Podcasts
"I love the Fiction Writing Made Easy podcast!" ‚Üê If that sounds like you, please consider rating and reviewing this show! Your rating and review will help other writers find this podcast, and they're also super fun for me to read. Just click here, scroll all the way to the bottom, tap five stars to rate the show, and then select "Write a Review." Be sure to let me know your favorite episodes, too!¬†
Also, if you haven't done so already, make sure you're following the podcast! I'll be adding a bunch of bonus episodes to the feed, and if you're not following the show, there's a good chance you'll miss them. Click here to follow now!
üîó Links mentioned in this episode:
Samantha Skal‚Äôs websiteShadows & Secrets RetreatsFreebie: 17 Thriller Twist Ideas to Jumpstart Your BrainstormingFREE QUIZ:¬†Take this 30-second quiz to get a custom action plan that'll help you move from stuck writer to published author!
Support the show
üëâ Looking for a transcript? If you‚Äôre listening on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, scroll down below the episode player until you see the transcript.

description.standard:
Fiction Writing Made Easy is your go-to podcast for practical, no-fluff tips on how to write, edit, and publish a novel‚Äîfrom first draft to finished book. Hosted by developmental editor and book coach Savannah Gilbo, this show breaks down the fiction writing process into clear, actionable steps so you can finally make progress on your manuscript.

Whether you're a first-time author or a seasoned writer looking to sharpen your skills, each episode offers insights on novel writing, story structure, character development, world-building, editing, and publishing. Savannah also shares mindset tips, writing routines, and revision strategies to help you stay motivated and finish your novel with confidence.

If you're asking these questions, you're in the right place:

How do I write a novel without experience?What‚Äôs the best way to structure a story that works?How do I develop strong characters and build immersive worlds?How do I edit or revise my first draft?When is my book ready to publish?What are my self-publishing and traditional publishing options?
New episodes drop weekly to help you write a novel you're proud of‚Äîand get it into readers‚Äô hands.

attributes.name: Fiction Writing Made Easy | Top Creative Writing Podcast for Fiction Writers & Writing Tips

description.standard:
This is another Disney themed episode because I love Disney and seen most of the movies. With that said these are my opinions, don't take these opinions too seriously. At the end of the day, we are all human beings who have different thoughts. Also, the movies are being discussed are from the Walt Disney Animation Canon, so any movies from the DisneyToon Studios, Pixar Animation, Lucasfilm, Marvel Studios, 20th Century Studios, Searchlight Pictures, and Blue Sky Studios are not going to be discussed thoroughly. (This is for people that might not understand me because I feel like people just don't understand me when I talk.)¬†*Spoilers for the Disney Movies*¬†

His tough questioning and attention to detail has given him the reputation of being a fierce debater. In 2009, Arun was awarded the Best Regular Non-Music Feature Award by Pure 107.8FM.

description.standard:
The Spooky Season is upon us and the guys are ready to celebrate! The next two months will be rich of celebration of horror. With a new Alien film released in 2024, there‚Äôs no better time for the guys to celebrate the 45th anniversary of the one that started it all, Ridley Scott‚Äôs Alien. Joining David Jack, a returning Hunter is special guest Rory and Luk to break it all down. Where do the guys land on ALIEN? Tune in and Find out! Love what you hear? Let your¬† friends know and leave us a review! LISTEN & SUBSCRIBE Reel [‚Ä¶]

The post 292: Alien: 45th Anniversary appeared first on The Cinematic Reel.

Subscribe to Reel Chronicles wherever you listen to podcasts. Be sure to visit our site at www.thecinematicreel.com, follow us on social media, and leave us a review.

description.standard: Terrance and Gretchen are joined by Hogwarts Radio's own social media manager, Sydney Mook.  In this week's episode, the hosts discuss the box office numbers for Crimes of Grindelwald. Where did WB go wrong? What made this movie opening different?  They also dive into each CoG character arc. Join us next week for episode 225, and follow our wonderful hosts!

description.standard:
Star Trek INTO DARKNESS.
 In this episode of Standard Orbit, your Refit Crew continues their voyage through the Original Series ‚ÄúKelvin Era‚Äù Movies with Star Trek INTO DARKNESS; the much anticipated sequel to Star Trek 2009. For the past few months, the Refit Crew has been discussing at length, the Original Series Era movies while navigating towards their final destination of BEYOND at temporal coordinates 07.22.16. After nearly 4 years of the critical and financial success of the 2009 Reboot, INTO DARKNESS roared back onto the big screen.
 Even though it was the highest ever grossing Star Trek movie, earning over $467 million dollars worldwide, many ‚ÄúTrekkies‚Äù believed that this movie was the furthest from Gene Roddenberry‚Äôs original vision. The themes of this movie were of a darker tone, challenging not only veteran Trekkies, but a modern audience as well as INTO DARKNESS presented a future that was quite different from The Original Series source material. INTO DARKNESS definitely ushered in a new era of Star Trek cinematic storytelling. And then there was the "wrath" of Khan...or was it the "wrath" of the fans?
 Hosts Ken Tripp, Jeffrey Harlan and Zach Moore
 Feature Welcome to Standard Orbit! (00:01:20) Trekking Into Darkness (00:02:45) Maintaining a Positive Energy Field (00:06:06) Losing Structural Integrity! (00:12:31) To Khan or Not to Khan (00:21:07) Bigger isn‚Äôt always Better (00:28:30) The Marcus Legacy (00:34:37) No Menagerie for Pike (00:42:06) Out of Darkness? (00:55:11) Thank You for Listening to Standard Orbit (01:04:29)
 Production C Bryan Jones (Executive Producer), Norman C. Lao (Executive Producer), Matthew Rushing (Executive Producer), Charlene Schmiedt (Executive Producer), Ken Tripp (Editor and Associate Producer), Renee Roberts (Associate Producer), Richard Rutledge (Associate Producer), Aaron Harvey (Associate Producer), Richard Marquez (Production Manager)

description.standard:
Fiction Writing Made Easy is your go-to podcast for practical, no-fluff tips on how to write, edit, and publish a novel‚Äîfrom first draft to finished book. Hosted by developmental editor and book coach Savannah Gilbo, this show breaks down the fiction writing process into clear, actionable steps so you can finally make progress on your manuscript.

Whether you're a first-time author or a seasoned writer looking to sharpen your skills, each episode offers insights on novel writing, story structure, character development, world-building, editing, and publishing. Savannah also shares mindset tips, writing routines, and revision strategies to help you stay motivated and finish your novel with confidence.

If you're asking these questions, you're in the right place:

How do I write a novel without experience?What‚Äôs the best way to structure a story that works?How do I develop strong characters and build immersive worlds?How do I edit or revise my first draft?When is my book ready to publish?What are my self-publishing and traditional publishing options?
New episodes drop weekly to help you write a novel you're proud of‚Äîand get it into readers‚Äô hands.

attributes.name: Fiction Writing Made Easy | Top Creative Writing Podcast for Fiction Writers & Writing Tips

description.standard: Two brothers badly proselytizing about our brand of geek; 50% content, 50% tangents.
The show that contains awesome debates, rankings, reviews, and rants about our favorite films, games, TV, and more! New episodes out every Sunday!

Calling all legends! Local narcissists, Jason and Alaina, provide colorful commentary on the cultural zeitgeist, including, but not limited to, pop culture, film, tv, music, theater, and MUCH more-TRUST! Rate us five stars or don‚Äôt listen!!! Xoxo
Host Johnny Curl sits down with old and new friends. Having a laugh, Cracking jokes and having stupid/insightful conversations.

Mark is a wizard. Josh is a wizard. Together they dive into all manner of arcana, esoterica, and apocrypha. Like professional wrestling, Conan the Barbarian, the cosmic vastness of space, the sunken mysteries of the deep, Greek tragedy, David Bowie, pipe tobacco, beer, and anything else that resonates on this material plane. And unlike those other jerk wizards, these two want to share their knowledge with you.

A Podcast where Connor and David come together to discuss movies, video games, tv, music, anime, and whatever else they‚Äôre thinking about. We do short form episodes called Think Stink, where we talk about forgotten and neglected films we find interesting, and then long form episodes about whatever, interchangeably. New episodes drop every 2 weeks, either Sunday or Monday. Release days may vary.

Comedy show with two screen writer friends who write a movie scene by scene.

It‚Äôs The Cacti Life! Join Isa and Yewande as they discuss everything from pop culture to history to personal experiences. It may be tangential, but there‚Äôs always a point to it (we promise).

What else do you do with a degree in liberal arts except start a media podcast? Introducing The Liberal Artists! Bodio, Kaylie and Gibby explore the world of new media with a critical eye and the hottest of takes. New episodes every other Thursday.

Join sisters Macey and Ashlee as they discuss movies, books, and TV series they are geeking out about. Whether it's Star Wars or Marvel, this duo will be sure to entertain you with their sisterly banter and discussions.
Three longtime friends Jon, Alphonso, Darren bring shenanigans and food for thought with a wide variety of characters-- all for your listening enjoyment.

Andrew Parker (Wafellow) & Alex Azor (Hat Guy) discuss their thoughts and opinions on anything and everything in pop culture, but at the end of the day this is a podcast about Superheroes, Horses, and Docking.
3 movie-loving millennial goofs
Just 3 movie loving millenial goofs

Two ametuer writers talk about their journey to become well practiced in their craft. They talk about their philosophies on writing and storytelling, their opinions on topics, genres, or tropes in storytelling, and even their own personal stories they are working on.
The Club Kayfabe Creative Community brings you a collection of fun and entertaining podcasts. Home of the long running Club Kayfabe WrestleTalk.

description.standard:
WDW Radio is the award-winning Disney podcast that brings the magic of Walt Disney World, Disneyland, Disney Cruise Line, Marvel, and Star Wars to life. Since 2005, hosted by Lou Mongello ‚Äì Disney expert, author, speaker, and Podcast Hall of Fame inductee ‚Äì has been your trusted guide through the parks and beyond.

Each week, tune in for Disney news, vacation planning tips, interviews, trivia, deep dives into Disney history, attraction and dining reviews, hidden park secrets, and more. From first-timer visitors to lifelong fans, this family-friendly podcast shares the tips, stories, secrets, and insights to help you plan smarter, experience more, and feel the magic like never before.

Voted Best Travel Podcast 9 years in a row, WDW Radio also features a blog, videos, live shows, community meetups, group cruises, and special Disney fan events around the world.

WDW Radio has welcomed legendary guests including Julie Andrews, Tony Baxter, Marty Sklar, Alan Menken, Richard Sherman, Paige O‚ÄôHara, Jodi Benson, Kevin Feige, Ashley Eckstein, and countless Imagineers, Cast Members, actors, producers, and creators who bring Disney magic to life.

Explore Lou‚Äôs books (Walt Disney World Trivia, The Disney Interviews, 102 Ways to Save Money For and At Walt Disney World) and virtual Audio Tours at WDWRadio.com.

Lou is also the founder of the Dream Team Project, which has raised more than $550,000 to grant wishes for children to visit Walt Disney World through the Make-A-Wish Foundation.

Start listening now to discover the stories, secrets, and magic that make the Disney Parks, Cruise Line, Marvel, and Star Wars truly unforgettable.

üéôÔ∏è Learn more at WDWRadio.com

‚ú® Lou Mongello is an acclaimed keynote speaker and founder of Momentum ‚Äì a transformative platform of events, coaching, courses, content, and community. He provides creators and entrepreneurs with practical guidance and inspiration to help turn passion into profession, build an audience with purpose, and grow a meaningful, sustainable business.

As a speaker, Lou shares powerful business and leadership lessons from the Disney Parks and Walt Disney himself, helping organizations improve storytelling, customer experience, company culture, and innovation through unforgettable, actionable presentations.

üîó Discover more at LouMongello.com

attributes.name: WDW Radio: Your Guide to the Walt Disney World, Disneyland, Disney Cruise and More Disney Magic!

We're watching every episode of Supernatural. Oh god.

Join Ari and Ben as they force their friend Travis to watch every single episode of Supernatural until one or all of them are dead.

Welcome to Flix and Chill! Our host Luke (@lost_movies on X, inMoviesLost on Letterboxd) will have conversations with guests to get to know them and talk about movies! No topic is off limits so come have a conversation and get to know various people who love movies! Luke is a seasoned movie lover with his own movie blog Lost In Movies. Check it out at lostinmovies.co.uk. Luke is also a frequent contributor on SiftPop (https://www.siftpop.com/?s=luke+burian) and he also appears on the SiftPop Writer's Room podcast and The Scribe Podcast.

Welcome to the SPDM Crew! We're a podcast network geared for people who are looking to listen a variety of different podcasts from aspiring hosts. As a community, we strive to be supportive of one another, encourage experimentation, and take your podcast from an idea to reality. If you're interested in starting a podcast, what are you waiting for? Let's work together to see what kind of idea you have! Email spdmcrew@gmail.com to inquire about starting a podcast. Again, welcome to the SPDM crew and we look forward to bringing you new podcasts! Shout out to Jason Wilbur for our awesome logo!

description.standard:
Master the art of the jaw-dropping plot twist and transform your readers from passive page-turners into gasping, can't-put-it-down fans.
Ever gasped out loud while reading a thriller? That moment when everything flips upside down and you think, "I should have seen it coming!" üò±
That's the power of a well-crafted plot twist.
Creating these goosebump-inducing moments isn't magic‚Äîit's a skill that any writer can master, even if you‚Äôre just starting out. And who better to learn from than someone whose superpower is brainstorming plot twists?
Samantha Skal is the director of Thriller Fest, the co-founder of Shadows and Secrets Writing Retreats (held in Salem‚Äôs most haunted hotel!), and a certified Author Accelerator book coach specializing in mystery, thriller, and suspense. So to say she knows a thing or two about crafting plot twists would be an understatement.
In the episode, you‚Äôll hear us talk about things like:
[04:45] The difference between using red herrings in mysteries and thrillers(and why mixing them up might be killing your story's suspense)[07:11] Why "playing fair" with readers is the cardinal rule of plot twist writing‚Äîand how breaking it turns clever twists into manipulative disappointments[15:12] Why starting with your villain (not your protagonist) is the secret to crafting plot twists that are surprising yet inevitable[24:00] How your character's personal baggage can become your most powerful tool for misdirecting readers (without feeling manipulative)[40:45] The counterintuitive reason why vague storytelling kills suspense‚Äîand what to do instead to create maximum tensionWhether you're excited to start your first novel or stuck somewhere in the middle of a manuscript, wondering how to surprise your readers, this episode will help you craft plot twists that feel both surprising and inevitable.¬†
‚≠ê Rate + Review + Follow on Apple Podcasts
"I love the Fiction Writing Made Easy podcast!" ‚Üê If that sounds like you, please consider rating and reviewing this show! Your rating and review will help other writers find this podcast, and they're also super fun for me to read. Just click here, scroll all the way to the bottom, tap five stars to rate the show, and then select "Write a Review." Be sure to let me know your favorite episodes, too!¬†
Also, if you haven't done so already, make sure you're following the podcast! I'll be adding a bunch of bonus episodes to the feed, and if you're not following the show, there's a good chance you'll miss them. Click here to follow now!
üîó Links mentioned in this episode:
Samantha Skal‚Äôs websiteShadows & Secrets RetreatsFreebie: 17 Thriller Twist Ideas to Jumpstart Your BrainstormingFREE QUIZ:¬†Take this 30-second quiz to get a custom action plan that'll help you move from stuck writer to published author!
Support the show
üëâ Looking for a transcript? If you‚Äôre listening on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, scroll down below the episode player until you see the transcript.

The Arun Mehta Show is a topical talk radio show featuring news, politics, entertainment and sports. Featuring various interviews, debate and opinion segments.

His tough questioning and attention to detail has given him the reputation of being a fierce debater. In 2009, Arun was awarded the Best Regular Non-Music Feature Award by Pure 107.8FM.

description.standard:
The Spooky Season is upon us and the guys are ready to celebrate! The next two months will be rich of celebration of horror. With a new Alien film released in 2024, there‚Äôs no better time for the guys to celebrate the 45th anniversary of the one that started it all, Ridley Scott‚Äôs Alien. Joining David Jack, a returning Hunter is special guest Rory and Luk to break it all down. Where do the guys land on ALIEN? Tune in and Find out! Love what you hear? Let your¬† friends know and leave us a review! LISTEN & SUBSCRIBE Reel [‚Ä¶]

The post 292: Alien: 45th Anniversary appeared first on The Cinematic Reel.

Subscribe to Reel Chronicles wherever you listen to podcasts. Be sure to visit our site at www.thecinematicreel.com, follow us on social media, and leave us a review.

description.standard: Terrance and Gretchen are joined by Hogwarts Radio's own social media manager, Sydney Mook.  In this week's episode, the hosts discuss the box office numbers for Crimes of Grindelwald. Where did WB go wrong? What made this movie opening different?  They also dive into each CoG character arc. What did each character do in this movie? What does the future hold for our heroes and villains?  The hosts end with a rousing game of Avada Kedavra, Amortentia, Imperio!  Join us next week for episode 225, and follow our wonderful hosts!

description.standard:
Star Trek INTO DARKNESS.
 In this episode of Standard Orbit, your Refit Crew continues their voyage through the Original Series ‚ÄúKelvin Era‚Äù Movies with Star Trek INTO DARKNESS; the much anticipated sequel to Star Trek 2009. For the past few months, the Refit Crew has been discussing at length, the Original Series Era movies while navigating towards their final destination of BEYOND at temporal coordinates 07.22.16. After nearly 4 years of the critical and financial success of the 2009 Reboot, INTO DARKNESS roared back onto the big screen.
 Even though it was the highest ever grossing Star Trek movie, earning over $467 million dollars worldwide, many ‚ÄúTrekkies‚Äù believed that this movie was the furthest from Gene Roddenberry‚Äôs original vision. The themes of this movie were of a darker tone, challenging not only veteran Trekkies, but a modern audience as well as INTO DARKNESS presented a future that was quite different from The Original Series source material. INTO DARKNESS definitely ushered in a new era of Star Trek cinematic storytelling. And then there was the "wrath" of Khan...or was it the "wrath" of the fans?
 Hosts Ken Tripp, Jeffrey Harlan and Zach Moore
 Feature Welcome to Standard Orbit! (00:01:20) Trekking Into Darkness (00:02:45) Maintaining a Positive Energy Field (00:06:06) Losing Structural Integrity! (00:12:31) To Khan or Not to Khan (00:21:07) Bigger isn‚Äôt always Better (00:28:30) The Marcus Legacy (00:34:37) No Menagerie for Pike (00:42:06) Out of Darkness? (00:55:11) Thank You for Listening to Standard Orbit (01:04:29)
 Production C Bryan Jones (Executive Producer), Norman C. Lao (Executive Producer), Matthew Rushing (Executive Producer), Charlene Schmiedt (Executive Producer), Ken Tripp (Editor and Associate Producer), Renee Roberts (Associate Producer), Richard Rutledge (Associate Producer), Aaron Harvey (Associate Producer), Richard Marquez (Production Manager)

description.standard: Mark is a wizard. Josh is a wizard. Together they dive into all manner of arcana, esoterica, and apocrypha. Like professional wrestling, Conan the Barbarian, the cosmic vastness of space, the sunken mysteries of the deep, Greek tragedy, David Bowie, pipe tobacco, beer, and anything else that resonates on this material plane. And unlike those other jerk wizards, these two want to share their knowledge with you.

description.standard: Good morning, afternoon, and evening! Everybody loves a Disney Villain, but where have they all gone? Where are the cackling madmen, the plotting marauders, the malevolent manipulators? Are they still relevant for today's storytelling, or do they come from a checkered past of queer-coding? Bodio, Kaylie, and Andy discuss all this and more about your favorite Disney Villains! Also included: bad impressions, SPRANG BRAAAAAKE, and getting lost in Florida.

description.standard:
On this week's cinematic episode of The Scat Cast, Alphonso approaches the boys with his biggest pet peeve... REMAKES. Why does Toothless look like that? Did we really need another Aladdin?
